com.facebook.react.devsupport

Interface HMRClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    JavaScriptModule

    public interface HMRClient
extends JavaScriptModule
    JS module interface for HMRClient

    The HMR(Hot Module Replacement)Client allows for the application to receive updates from the packager server (over a web socket), allowing for injection of JavaScript to the running application (without a refresh).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void disable()
      Turns off the HMR client so it doesn't process updates from the packager.
      void enable()
      Sets up a connection to the packager when called the first time.
      void setup(java.lang.String platform, java.lang.String bundleEntry, java.lang.String host, int port, boolean isEnabled)
      Enable the HMRClient so that the client will receive updates from the packager server.

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        void setup(java.lang.String platform,
           java.lang.String bundleEntry,
           java.lang.String host,
           int port,
           boolean isEnabled)
        Enable the HMRClient so that the client will receive updates from the packager server.
        Parameters:
        platform - The platform in which HMR updates will be enabled. Should be "android".
        bundleEntry - The path to the bundle entry file (e.g. index.ios.bundle).
        host - The host that the HMRClient should communicate with.
        port - The port that the HMRClient should communicate with on the host.
        isEnabled - Whether HMR is enabled initially.

      • enable

        void enable()
        Sets up a connection to the packager when called the first time. Ensures code updates received from the packager are applied.

      • disable

        void disable()
        Turns off the HMR client so it doesn't process updates from the packager.
